Plot: A man working at his parents' motel in the Catskills inadvertently sets in motion the generation-defining concert in the summer of 1969.
Title: Taking Woodstock
Writer: James Schamus (screenplay), Elliot Tiber (book), Tom Monte (book)
Actors: Henry Goodman, Edward Hibbert, Imelda Staunton, Demetri Martin
tomatoConsensus: Featuring numerous 60s-era clichés, but little of the musical magic that highlighted the famous festival, Taking Woodstock is a breezy but underwhelming portrayal.
